page.title: 14WORK
page.content: We asked people where they worked and how far they had to travel to work if they were not employed locally. The majority of people interviewed were retired. Of those of working age thirteen worked outside the village - eleven in Cheltenham and two in Gloucester. The furthest distance travelled to work was eighteen miles. Only two people interviewed worked locally and one of these was the village sub-postmaster. The other people interviewed who were not working classed themselves as housewives and only one person stated he was unemployed. This reflects the relatively low level of unemployment in the area. Our results also reflect that there is little local employment - at least of a status which enables people to afford houses in the village.
